metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9130 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
scanner.c in LibYAML 0.1.5 and 0.1.6, as used in the YAML-LibYAML (aka YAML-XS) module for Perl, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and crash) via vectors involving line-wrapping.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libyaml-0-2 - 0.1.4-3ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

libyaml-libyaml-perl - 0.41-5ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

python-yaml - 3.10-4ubuntu0.1
python3-yaml - 3.10-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> pyyaml may receive its own CVE mdeslaur> perl PoC: http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/11/28/6 sbeattie> ruby1.9+ uses libyaml-0-2, so it's fixed when libyaml is fixed

criterions.comment: libyaml package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.1.4-3ubuntu3.1').
libyaml-libyaml-perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41-5ubuntu0.14.04.1').
pyyaml package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10-4ubuntu0.1').
